Behemoth
Behemoth roles vary depending on the Modules you equip them with. They can focus on economic, scientific, or military capacities.
Juggernaut

The Juggernaut is the biggest and strongest ship in the galaxy. It can be embedded in fleets and can be further upgraded, either by having more slots, or by unlocking the Ion Wave, a powerful ability which damages all fleets present on the node.
Obliterator

The Obliterator channels all the capacities of its enormous hull into a single, powerful cannon. As a result, it has a very limited number of slots but can fire missiles that trek across the galaxy to destroy whole star systems from afar. It can be further upgraded either to fire more often, or have faster missiles.
Behemoth

Honor and glory to our ancestors and praise to the Sun God! The Hissho have established themselves as the rightful leaders of galactic civilization.

Looking back, victory was inevitable. Hissho courage, a sense of duty and honor, and devout blood sacrifices to Tonatsi permit no other outcome. The nation of the Hissho are the supreme power, and their traditions will be respected across the galaxy.
The Hissho fall in defeat; another empire is victorious.
Was the failing in honor, devotion, or dedication? A lack of training, rigour, or piety? Whatever the cause, another empire has taken control of the galaxy, and the mighty Hissho taste defeat.

Specialize
Specialize the selected Behemoth into a destructive Obliterator, a powerful Juggernaut or a massive Citadel
Citadel

Specializing your Behemoth into a CitadelÂ will turn it into a multi-purpose defensive fortress. The ship will reinforce the system and will disappear after specialization.
The Citadel unlocks the possibility to build unique improvements for the system it's built on. It also provides a native defense against Obliterator projectiles (which can be further reinforced by the Obliterator Shield, to be fully protected against any attack), a natural "Guard" action on the node, and prevents any free movement on the node, as well as providing an additional garrison of unsiegable manpower and strengthening troop stats on the system.
Note: The Citadel Shield effect is permanent on the System regardless of ownership.
Finally, it also adds economic bonuses to your system, which can be further increased by the improvements you can unlock.

Endless Space 2: Supremacy

This second expansion brings back the honor-bound warriors of the Endless Universe: the Hissho. Struggling to understand both their past and their future, the blood rites and bloodletting of this warrior race seem alien to a galactic community. Regardless, they exemplify the Hissho primary choice of diplomacy: Warfare.

The original species of Hissho find themselves at a crossroads. Torn between the ancient past as slaves of the Endless, their own traditions, and their instinctive drive to dominate, they seek a place in an increasingly complex galaxy. While their traditions of honor and loyalty give them a rock to hold onto in this torrent of change, their leader, Emperor Iyolo Blackgyr must pull together a society troubled by ancient wrongs, eager reformers, and steadfast traditionalists.

Endless Space 2: Supremacy introduces the Hissho Major faction as well as a new massive galactic platform available to all factions: the Behemoth Ship.
Content: - Hissho major civilization - Hissho ships - Four new Heroes - Hissho faction Quest - Keii mechanic - Behemoth-class ships - Three Behemoth specializations (Obliterator, Battleship & Citadel) - Illo Minor Faction + Hero - Memorial battlefields - Other rockin' stuff

Hissho
Fierce and aggressive, Hissho are fearless in battle. Driven by a sense of honor and respect for tradition, they prefer war to peace.
Honor Bound

The loyalty of the Hissho to their leaders depends on the sense of honor and glory accrued to the empire. Completing quests and taking part in battles are the sorts of activities that improve this rating.
Honor, Blood, and Memory

Warriors from a culture of blood sacrifice, the Hissho must rewrite their past as slaves and gladiators into a glorious future. The first to discover Behemoth technology--inadvertently reactivated by a sword also fashioned in foundries of the Endless--their destiny will be written in battle with the blood of their enemies.

Two major concepts form the core of Hissho society: sacrifice and loyalty. They are capable of spilling their own blood, or others', to gain the blessings of their gods and their ancestors. Death in battle is preferable to defeat, and the word 'retreat' is not one a Hissho wishes to utter. Driven to gain "keii"--a combination of honor and duty--the Hissho are a fierce and relentless adversary.

Can accumulate Keii and use it to launch Keii actions to boost the military and production capacities of systems. Keii also determines empire and system Obedience, which replaces Approval. +40% [honorColored] gain after a space battle under the Keii zone of Behemoths.
Systems rebel when an empire is in Anarchy due to low [happinessColored] orÂ [obedienceColored]
Can see paths and destinations of Fleets of empires you are at war with

Hissho

Fierce and aggressive, driven by their sense of honor, the Hissho are fearless in battle. Preferring war to peace, their nation has by tradition sought conquest and glory. While their reigning emperor, Iyolo Blackgyr, is a strong and worthy leader, he is unused to the complexities of running a multi-planet galactic empire. The Hissho government has always been centrally controlled, and both the volume and complexity of decisions means that even a gifted ruler has difficulty managing an entity of this scope. It is therefore a time of change and adaptation, a time of unrest, a time of hard decisions. It is also a time when the Hissho are faced with questions of their past with the Endless, as well as their future in galactic society.
Illo

The Illo are reasoning machines, who are faith-based for a simple reason: As the argument that life evolved on its own is mathematically improbable, the logical conclusion is that a Divine Will exists. In addition, observation tells us that this Divine Will created the galaxy as a set of limited resources. Therefore, regardless of the number of nations and species, it will finish as a Zero Sum obliteration of all but the best adapted. Obviously, because the galaxy has been designed this way, it is Divine Will that this winnowing occurs; it is also clear to the Illo that hastening the end by eliminating lesser species is not only appropriate, but ordained.
Sacred Tradition
While leaders may be overthrown, Hissho do not question the form of government that has led them successfully for centuries.
Observances

The Hissho maintain a rotating calendar of traditional Observances to gain favor with their gods. These may be seen as gruesome and bloodthirsty by outsiders, but to the Hissho they are part of ancient tradition.
Illo Citizens
+1 [illo] on your Home System

The Illo are reasoning machines, who are faith-based for a simple reason: As the argument that life evolved on its own is mathematically improbable, the logical conclusion is that a Divine Will exists. In addition, observation tells them that this Divine Will created the galaxy as a set of limited resources. Therefore, regardless of the number of nations and species, it will finish as a Zero Sum obliteration of all but the best adapted. Obviously, because the galaxy has been designed this way, it is Divine Will that this winnowing occurs. The Illo credo is Survival of the Fittest; their goal is to reach this Sanctified Equilibrium as quickly as possible by eliminating those species unlikely to survive in the long term.
The government type does not change when in rebellion.
With every election, a new Observance becomes available. Sacrificing a population will give your Empire the effects of the Observance.

Kogewa Brightblade

Brightblade is a highly decorated warrior, famous not only for strategy and tactics but also for sheer battlefield ferocity. A leader as much as a fighter, he was a natural choice when the time came to appoint a new leader to the Order of the Black Eagle. This elite school and military unit has thrived under his command, as he leads rigorously and remorselessly by example and from the front. Blunt, gruff, short-tempered, and impatient, his followers--whether they thrive or die--are eager and proud to serve beneath him.
Senya Snowridge

Snowridge comes from a long line of warriors; for generations her family has bred their children for warfare and the hunt. Though not an outright Reformer, Snowridge is one of few Hissho who has trained at the Academy, seeking further perfection within her deadly arts through non-Hissho education. Though she rarely fights, choosing both military and political battles with care, she has never lost. This invincibility is attributed to the way she has devoted her life to the pure melding of mind and body; the integration of weapon, tactic, and will. She is known behind her back as "Iceridge" for her implacable and emotionless approach to the passions of war. Many attribute this to her presence at the death of her father on the planet Veil, but that is another story.
Butska Graysand

Graysand grew up practicing with staves, rather than swords, and was viewed as a bit of an eccentric because of that. However, as he came from the Windshorn Uplands, a mountainous area with a history of defensive wars against neighboring clans, Graysand's preference for a defensive weapon was viewed with indulgence rather than disdain. As time went on he became a noted strategist in the area of defensive planning and tactics, extending the idea far beyond pure military thought into the efficient use of industry and the exploitation of agricultural resources. Though he lives in a time when the Hissho clans are at peace, computer simulations indicate that had he been alive during the Warring Clans Era, he would probably have become the youngest emperor in Hissho history. His Dust augmentation was carefully planned, flawlessly executed, and has been rigorously exploited.
Tsuyu Saltcliff

An expert in Hissho history and traditions, some say Saltcliff's reverence for the past is well beyond an obsession. Few would say that to her face, however, for there may be no other living Hissho that has her mastery with a blade. Much of this skill comes from her detailed study of the Hissho legacy within the arenas of the Endless; a kill-or-be-killed existence where the ability to win mortal struggles on a daily basis led to extreme training and techniques. She has also studied many of the details of the Endless impact on Hissho genes, society, and development during her more reflective moments. It is rumored that she seeks, in particular, the wisdom and journals of the Blood Sisters, and some even say she is driving an underground movement to restore their order.
Hissho
Hissho Heroes show their dedication to conquest with improved Industry and Agriculture for the war effort.
Hissho Skills
This branch contains the Hissho-specific skills.
Illo
Illo Hero
Tlikkit Goktok

Though they speak of it very little, Goktok is in fact a priest in the religion of the Illo. Their church, like their society, is dedicated to accelerating the forces of evolution and natural selection, and it was to study these powers in detail that they applied to do research at the Academy. Discovering the uses of Dust, the powers of Heroes, and the very low odds of survival when augmented by it, Goktok immediately volunteered based on the following logic: - Dust will destroy or ennoble me - Should I be destroyed, that is Divine Will executing its remorseless winnowing of the weak, and that would be a good thing as it means I am unworthy to live - Should I be ennobled, it will be clear that I am a chosen of the Divine Will and it is therefore my duty to reach this state and execute that will While fellow pupils and even employers find their fanaticism somewhat odd, they don't worry too much as Goktok delivers results along with their sermons.
The Book of Five Wings
In-depth study of texts and simulations by the Hissho strategy master, Kochita, leads to the highest level of battle prowess.
Behemoth Secrets
Study of Endless technology and improvement of Behemoth systems means Behemoths are less costly to produce, and can be more numerous in your fleets.

Empire Obedience
The total Obedience of your empire, bound to your Keii. High and low Obedience values can influence the [scienceColored] and [dustColored] outputs of your Systems.
System Obedience
The Obedience level of people living in this star system. High and low approval values can influence the [foodColored] and [prestigeColored] outputs of the star system.

Obedience

Behemoth Generators
Massively increasing the power output of the Behemoth design will permit the ships to be equipped with more powerful engines and scanners.
Behemoth tech SE 2
Base vision + vision module unlock
Behemoth Analyzers
Given the enormous power generation and available space on Behemoth research platforms, enhanced systems can be installed that exploit the unusual qualities of Special Nodes.
Behemoth Basic Climatology
Behemoth research platforms are large and powerful enough to accept specialized systems that act on anomalies and ecosystems from space.
Behemoth Advanced Climatology
A new generation of power and computing systems will allow Behemoths to act more efficiently on planetary ecosystems and geology.
Behemoth Blueprints
These massive galactic platforms can be adapted for war, research, or exploitation. Working out the basic systems permits, in an initial phase, pacific uses of Behemoth-class ships.
Citadel Blueprints
This is a major reworking of the Behemoth-class designs, specifically intended for building defensive systems.
Citadel Basic Upgrade
This next generation of Citadel-rated Behemoth-class platforms adds slow offensive weapons and basic shielding from Obliterator missiles.
Citadel Advanced Upgrade
These improvements to Citadel-rated Behemoth-class platforms increase the power of their weapons and add defensive capabilities to the System.
Citadel Extensions
Given that there is already a substantial technological base in a system defended by a Citadel, additional scientific and industrial research can be done in parallel with the Citadel's primary role.
Behemoth Weaponization
This research improves Behemoth-class warships by perfecting the technology needed to equipÂ heavier weapons and more robust defenses.
Juggernaut Blueprints
This is a major reworking of the Behemoth-class designs, specifically intended for offensive military systems.
Obliterator Blueprints
This is a major reworking of the Juggernaut-rated Behemoth-class designs. The purpose is to create a giant weapons platform for system-destroying missiles.
Juggernaut Battle Upgrade
Enhancing the power output and the inertial stability of the Juggernaut hulls permits the use of heavier ship-to-ship weapons.
Juggernaut Module Upgrade
The unique, energy-enhanced properties of Quadrinix are exploited to increase the number of module slots on Juggernaut hulls.
Obliterator Missile Velocity
Advancements in hull strength and module reliability will permit the firing of heavier Obliterator missiles that reach their target faster.
Obliterator Missile Frequency
By increasing internal radiation shields and siphoning energy from non-essential systems between shots, Obliterator missiles can be recharged and fired more often.
Behemoth tech ET 1
Gov support
Mission Flexibility
Improved communication and flexible space usage on Behemoth-class ships permit them to act as mobile government and system development centers.
Behemoth Exploitation 1
A combination of space stations and offshore drilling platforms of a different age, these giant space platforms can be redesigned to act as enormous resource exploitation operations.
Behemoth Exploitation 2
Improved power, material, and management systems greatly increase the flexibility and output of Behemoth-class mining operations.
Militarized Management
In the case of certain cultures, a melding of military hierarchy and managerial sciences can be done that greatly increases the efficiency of factory systems.
Behemoth Overdrive
Though risky, the ability to temporarily overclock Behemoth weapons systems can add a brief but powerful tactical advantage.
Behemoth Shield
A temporary but powerful increase in Behemoth defensive capability can be acheived by orienting all secondary systems into ablative protection and damage control.
Basic Behemoth Propulsion
A simple adaptation of Carrier-class engines for driving the enormous bulk of Behemoth-class ships.
Basic Behemoth Scanners
These scanning systems have been adapted for use on the unusual gravitational and magnetic environments of the Behemoth hulls.
Citadel Specialization

The production of defense-oriented Behemoth-class platforms is now possible in all the shipyards of the empire. Note: These are not mobile, but are tied to a System for defense. Additional unique improvements can be built to strengthen them.
Juggernaut Specialization
The production of attack-oriented Behemoth-class ships is now possible in all the shipyards of the empire.
Obliterator Specialization
The production of specialized, system-destroying Behemoth-class ships is now possible in all the shipyards of the empire.
Enhanced Behemoth Hull
Unlocks a Large Weapon slot and additional small slots for Military Behemoths
Enhanced Juggernauts
Unlocks additional [Strat06quadrinixColored] module slots for Juggernauts
Ion Wave
This massive Area of Effect weapon does 100% Damage to all ships on node except in the Juggernaut's fleet
Warp Missiles
These warp-accelerated Obliterator missiles reach their objectives faster.
Obliterator Reload
Improved recharge/repair systems allow Obliterator to fire more often or at lower cost
-25% delay between firing Obliterator missiles
Enhanced Behemoths
Unlocks additional support slots for Behemoths
Basic Offworld Mining
This is the basic rate at which Behemoth probes mine deposits on neutral planets
Mining Probes will harvest resources atÂ a $(Input) rate on Deposits
Mining Probes will extract [FIDS] at a $(Input) rate on Planets and add them to your Home System's planets' base [FIDS]
Improved Offworld Mining
Behemoth probes mine deposits on neutral worlds at a faster rate.
Extreme Offworld Mining
Behemoth probes mine deposits on neutral worlds at the fastest rate.
Hardened Behemoths
In order to improve the battle survivability to Behemoth-class designs, they must gain improved hulls, redundant systems, and greater self-sufficiency.
Flexible Behemoths
Some useful improvements for Behemoth-class ships would be additional slots for modules and greater survivability.
Improved Behemoths
Familiarity with the Behemoth-class hulls, after years of field testing, permits further customization and improvement of the design.
Behemoth Maximization
With advances in understanding of the Endless technology underlying the Behemoths, module slots can be maximized and hull survivability improved.
Set the Module multiplier to $(Input)x on Behemoths
+$(Input) Health on unspecialized Behemoths
Basic Cryogenics
Initial steps in the use of cryogenics for the transport and repair of troops gives basic improvements in durability and life expectation.
Behemoth Flight Systems
An indifference to risk and a desire to excel allows some empires to install massive engines on Behemoth-class hulls. Pilot and Navigator training is correspondingly more rigorous.
Hero's Memorial
So that no one forgets their sacrifice, a great monument is constructed in which the military conflicts of the empire are immortalized--and occasionally exaggerated.
Center forÂ Heart and Mind

This government research center encourages one to approach life and modern civilization in a holisitic manner. The emphasis on sustainable living and social harmony are universally appreciated, and alleviate some of the suspicions of political propaganda.
Enhanced Claw-class Hull
Enhanced Hover-class Hull
Enhanced Strike-class Hull
Enhanced Climb-class Hull
Enhanced Dive-class Hull
Behemoth Ceremony
By celebrating the launch of every new Behemoth with a public ceremony and positive spin, Keii improves with every new ship that enters service.
Behemoth Berserker
Hidden strategic and tacical lessons from a lost Hissho battlesage named "Kochita" are applied in this new battle plan. These principles of movement and fire plans boost the threat of solo Behemoths.
Unlock the Battle Tactic: Berserker
Behemoth Bastion

This tactic puts even non-military secondary systems into battle mode for defensive purposes--garbage ejected as anti-ablatives, power increased to shields, all mechanical systems annexed for damage control, etc.
Unlock the Battle Tactic: Endure
Obsidian Penance Center
Though the initial idea was to create meditative centers for purification on hostile planets, they have so appealed to the Hissho spirit that enormous population boosts are a consequence.
Obsidian Devotion Center
An expanded and improved version of the Penance Center, these city-sized centers of study and abnegation have attracted tenacious populations from across the empire.
Word of the Saints

Part charitable association, part center of proselytization, and part method of infiltration, this empire-wide network of committed citizens exhorts other species and believers to join the glory of the Church of the Virtual Saints.

Permits conversion of alien [population] Population on Systems within your empire's Influence area over time. Only usable if you are at Cold War or Peace with the other empire. Costs [prestigeColored] Influence, grants [lifeforceColored] Essence.
Unlock this specialization option for all your existing [Juggernaut] Behemoths. To specialize a [Juggernaut] Behemoth, select it in the Galaxy view and access the option from the ship list panel.

Unlock this specialization option for all your existing [Juggernaut] Behemoths. To specialize a [Juggernaut] Behemoth, select it in the Galaxy view and access the option from the ship list panel. Unlock the Ion Wave ability for [battleship] Juggernaut: it will instantly destroy all the fleets on the node (only ships in the [battleship] Juggernaut's fleet are immune). It will leave your [battleship] Juggernaut unable to move for 3 turns, and unable to attack if it is involved in a space battle.
Behemoth C3 Center

By setting up complicated communication, command and control arrays, the empire can manage additional Behemoths. Due to the complexity of the Behemoth systems, however, costs increase for each additional ship.

Your current total Behemoth Upkeep is {2}[upkeep]. This building will increase the Upkeep of each Behemoth you have now or in the future by 50%. Your current Upkeep will increase to a total of {3}[upkeep].

Your current total Behemoth Upkeep is {2}[upkeep]. This building will increase the Upkeep of each Behemoth you have now or in the future by 50%. Your current Upkeep will increase to a total of {1}[upkeep].
System Shield
An integrated system of satellite arrays, explosive mines, and energy shields, this is the ultimate in star system-level defensive structures.

Prevents the destruction of your system if it is targeted by an Obliterator. This Improvement is destroyed when it is used. Only 50% of population is killed, 50% of improvements (25% of Defense Improvements) are destroyed, and 50% damage is done to Ships in orbit. If a Hero is defending, they are injured 33% of the time.
System Battery
This slow-targeting but powerful addition to a Citadel-defended system can be used against enemy Fleets.
Allows the Citadel to fire one round of Blast Effect Battery (Inflicts 2000 damage on every enemy Ship) per phase in Space Battles. It can't be targeted.
Advanced System Battery
A more advanced version of the defensive battery, this does increased damage to enemy Fleets. In addition, repair and recharge facilities can aid in the repair of friendly Fleets.
Coordinated Bunkers
Integrating the Citadel defensive systems with planetary infrastructure greatly reduces the loss of troops during hostile invasions.
Scientific-Military Complex

By turning over parts of the giant Behemoth hull to research teams, and linking these directly to new planetary installations, flexible projects can be executed that speed scientific and industrial output.
Weaponized System

The goal of this effort is to convert a star system into a war machine. While the production of Food and Dust drop significantly, highly advanced weapons systems and highly trained troops turn this System into a very dangerous target.Â
Center of the Obsidian Eagle
This temple complex, dedicated to the major faith of the Hissho empire, is a center of learning, meditation, and rigorous self-development.
Red Blade Assemblage
Named for and run by the famed military order, this industrial center turns out Behemoth ship systems at high speed and and high quality.
+5 [prestigeColored] per Science Construction on Systems.
+15 [prestigeColored] on System with Minor [population]
+15 [prestigeColored] on System with Major [population]
+7 [prestigeColored] per [population] type.
Civilian Emergency Centers

These centers train experts who in turn train the general population in emergency response and survival. In addition, they stockpile food and medical supplies for emergencies, and are generally equipped with bunkers linked to rail and metro systems.
Koimachi Academy

This center of officer training and martial arts puts a unified, efficient, and modern image on the empire's military and especially its fleets. Highly trained as individuals and leaders, the graduates impress and awe wherever they go.
Academy of Teyotl

This vast and opulent center of religious and spiritual education is renowned both for its purity and its simplicity. A firm example of the empire's commitments to individual excellence and devotion, even non-believers who visit leave impressed and respectful.
Sykagoja Targeting System

Based on clues from historical texts and ancient technology from recovered Behemoth hulls, this advanced brain-computer interface improves weapon efficiency based on "soft" elements--like zeal, patriotism, and aggression--that could not previously be exploited.
Shrine of Eternal Sacrifice

A combination of war memorial, museum, and spiritual center, this temple painstakingly tracks the battles and sacrifices made by the empire's armies. Those who gain glory are revered, and those who fall are remembered and commemorated.
Diligence Ritual
Also known as Chawa Harkiz, this act of blood sacrifice is done by the Hissho to exhort the population to work harder and live more frugally.
Sun God's Ritual
Also known as Kapak Rayumi, this offering to the primary god of the HIssho converts ordinary citizens into warriors.
Ancestors' Ritual
Also known as Ayamaruka, this rite of devotion to the spirits of Hissho ancestors helps establish their claim to disputed Systems and accelerates their ability to take control.
Blood Ritual

Also known as the Ezukiza, it is a giant public sacrifice to the gods and ancestors. Citizens, criminals, and prisoners of war are often among those who sacrifice themselves voluntarily in return for prestige, family honor, gifts to their kin, and a brief moment of glory.
Converts 1 [population] into 5 [honorColored]

Glorious Bastion
This establishes a zone that the Hissho have declared as holy and sanctified. Great attention is paid to what occurs there, and the Hissho urge themselves to even greater deeds to reap greater glory.

Ancestral Reverence
In an act of traditional devotion, resources and produce are sent to the home world to increase the power and prestige of the government.

The system gains a high degree of autonomy thanks to the ability of recently appointed leaders from the Order of the Obsidian Eagle. The empire can continue expanding while keeping its spirit and people united.
Fealty Center
These centers for studying keii and instilling a diligent work ethic also require that local youth work part-time for the local economy.
Fealty Foundation
Expanded centers for studying keii and improving work efficiency, the Foundations are viewed as key recruiting grounds for the military.
Fealty Institute

Within these walls, intensive study and research is done to apply the selfless diligence of keii to all aspects of Hissho life. Leaders of the Hissho people teach here, and future leaders are rigorously trained.

Hi Sci Act
Concerned about the highly advanced civilizations that they face in the galaxy, a worried government demands that more time be spent doing research, at the cost of religious observances.

Hoping to better fit into the complex web of galactic politics, this law is passed which encourages the study of tenacious and warlike heroes of other civilizations. The expectation is that the proud Hissho will gain some grudging respect for other, less military cultures.

Chapter 1. The Blade and the Eagle - Part 1

In spring we yearn for the simplicity of war; Gardening is hard. ---------- The emperor himself wrote this poetry, in a classical form. It is good that he maintains some traditions, for the Hissho have been changing radically. New sciences, new organizations, new codes, new laws... I fear that we are forgetting our own history and values. There are even the Reformers, a group dedicated to adopting new galactic ways and consigning the old ways to museums. Many Hissho listen to them. But not I. My name is Tizio Blackridge, a teacher of military history and martial arts in the Redbone Islands of the Itazeke Sea. I will soon be rotating back to active duty after several years as an instructor, and I have been preparing for my next posting for years. I grew up on the tales of the Blood Sisters; I read their legends, studied their texts, practiced their martial arts. They are a memory of a time when the Hissho stood united against all, when the sanctity of the Nest was everything, when courage and honor were things that existed in daily life, not in stories. I will see the temples of the Blood Sisters reinstated, their feats of arms studied, their stoic and tenacious ways imitated with pride. Or I will die trying. Either outcome is acceptable. I am no gardener.
STRENGTH
We must first prove that we are worthy to speak of the Blood Sisters and tell their stories. Build ships that will serve to defend the Hissho, as they once did.
Build $Amount01Name [ship] Ships of at least $Amount02Name [defensiveMilitaryPower] Defensive Power.

Unlock new modules (using the Military Quadrant) or Ship Hulls (using the Empire Development Quadrant) and use the Ship Design screen to create Ships with higher Defense ratings. Â Note: Projectile weapons also have defensive power.
I feel the deck thrum beneath my claws, the thump of troops changing the watch. The ship is a living thing, a hunter, worthy of our ancestors.
FAITH
The Blood Sisters were not just killers; they represented a way of life that celebrated integrity and self-sacrifice for the good of all.
Assimilate $Amount03Name new Minor Faction.
"Assimilation" can also be done via Invasion and Brainwashing.Â You need to unlock the $Technology01Name technology to do diplomacy with Minor Factions, or you can declare War and Invade.
Let them come; let friends and enemies see the purity of our ways and the honor of our actions. We may appear strange, even brutal, but the galaxy is not a place for weakness.
Chapter 1. The Blade and the Eagle - Part 2
We face a challenge that the Blood Sisters did not--ruling new peoples and new planets. If the Emperor cannot do it, the Reformers will take it as a sign of weakness.
LEADERSHIP
It is one thing to win battles, it is another to federate the survivors into a nation.
Successfully Invade and Occupy $Amount01Name System(s)
You can invade the systems owned by a Minor or Major Civilization which is at war with you. You must destroy all defending fleets before you can invade.
The swift strike, the war cries, the clash of bladesâ¦ it seems that we are making our own stories, as great as those I read as a child. I doubt the Reformers cover themselves in such glory!
Chapter 1. The Blade and the Eagle - Part 2
It is easier, I think, for a Hissho to kill than to capture or manage. But we must hold our own desires in check at times, and do what is best for the empire.
DISCIPLINE
For the Blood Sisters to become the moral leaders of the Hissho, I must instill discipline and obedience in the population--by providing an example.
Reach $Amount02Name [honorColored] #BD4E58#Keii#REVERT# in your Empire.Â
Participate in Space Battles, Invasions or complete Quests and Deeds to increase your Keii gauge.
It is hard to be a role model; putting the empire and honor before everything means that little remains for oneself. But if I was not ready to accept that, I would never have lifted a sword.
DISCIPLINE
For a new temple of Blood Sisters to become the moral leaders of the Hissho, the population must learn to respect--or fear--our leadership.
Reach $Amount04Name [happinessColored] #F168CE#Approval#REVERT# in your Empire.Â
Build [happinessColored] #F168CE#Approval#REVERT# Buildings or avoid Overcolonization and Overpopulation in your Systems. You can also level up your System with Approval-related Luxury Resources.
It is hard to be a role model; I find it easier to remove a head than to change the way it thinks. But self-control is critical to the success of my plans. The Emperor's plans.
Chapter 2. The Force of Conviction

Temperatures and temperaments both rising. The hot season boils. ---------- Conflict presses us on every side. Those who revere the Endless fight with those who revile them. Those who seek new ways and new ideas scorn those who cleave to our traditions and worship Tonatsi. Pirates and aliens block our starlanes; warriors yell for new and better weapons while teachers moan over the distractions and seductions of the new galactic ways. Our society has become a boiling pot with its lid welded shut, and something is going to give. But it will not be me; it is not I who will break and forget my way. On the new colonies and among the new crews the tales of the Blood Sisters are spreading, and I have convinced many exasperated instructors the value of ancient rites and disciplines to control modern students. Twice now enemies have tried to kill me, but they should know better than to send assassins against one who studied the old ways as I have. They fight me now with propaganda, insisting that those who look only to the past can never wield the weapons of the future. But there are highly placed government officials who adhere to my ideals, and they are willing to give me a Behemoth to prove my point. Blessed be Tonatsi, God of the Sun; glory to Iyolo Blackgyr, emperor of the Hissho Bakufu. It is in the hottest fires that the sharpest blades are forged. As the hot season boils so does my blood, and so shall my enemies...
GLORY
As the blade is the extension of the arm, these new ships are the extension of our willâ¦
Win $Amount04Name Battles with Fleets that include a Behemoth-hull ship.
Improve your (Military) Behemoth through Military Technologies in order to defeat enemy Fleets.

There is a rumbling thunder when you ride the Behemoth, like the roaring of a thousand beasts just on the edge of your hearing. It is terror and fire, a terrible extension of indomitable will--the will of our traditions and of the Blood Sisters. I like it.
POWER
The Hissho need to see that âdefendingâ is more than just taking trophies from enemies. Strength also comes from economic power and control.
Produce $Amount03Name Strategic Resources per turn with a Behemoth for a duration of $Amount05Name [turn].

With a Behemoth equipped with a Mining Probe, orbit around a neutral System with a Strategic Resource deposit in order to gather that resource. You may need to unlock more advanced Behemoth Mining technologies to complete this.

The weapons rumble, the mining probes rumble, the giant beast that is the Behemoth growls like a living thing. Riches pour in from our efforts, as the newest of technologies are used to support and maintain our oldest ways. I have even knelt before the emperor, felt the hand of him they call the Blazehawk on my shoulder. I am ready to make the ultimate sacrifice, should he ask me. In fact, I am eager.
Chapter 3. Retrench or Reform - Part 1

Is it blood pooling or the fallen maple leaves, this red of autumn? --- It seems that I have found the Reformers' weakness, and they have found mine. They made the mistake of showing reverence for the Endless, and holding them up as an example of the heights to which an empire can aspire. Technology, mastery, power; it is a seductive vision. But it is a vision that reminds me of our time of slavery, submission, and helplessness. I am more than willing to spread this message; the Reformers are picking up the mantle of our long-dead overseers. Their message is one of corruption and gluttony. They would not make blood sacrifices to Tonatsi, calling our powerful traditions "barbaric". However, as our empire expands there are few of us who carry the message of loyalty and tradition. The speed of our growth has outrun our ability to travel and train, and I fear that my cause will be lost in the increasing babble of billions of voices. The Reformers are content to sit back, and let mathematics turn the tide in their favor. I do not sit back. Kochita himself said: When you appear weakest, attack.
ENLIST
The order must grow. We need more warriors to have more potential recruits for the Blood Sisters.
Reach $Amount02Name [manPowerColored] #D0D0D0#manpower#REVERT# capacity in your Empire.
The Manpower capacity is the maximum amount of Manpower you can stock. It is increased by certain Defense Improvements or by gaining ownership of additional Systems.

We are in the officer academies, the martial arts schools, the classrooms. Those who support and emulate the Blood Sisters flourish and grow, and our enemies have been caught off guard. In our society, lack of vigilance can be mortal.
FLOURISH
Convert, convince, and communicate. Do everything in your power to spread the image and influences of our traditions throughout the rapidly growing empire.
Generate $Amount04Name [prestigeColored] per [turn] in your Empire.

Build #A555E7#Influence#REVERT# System or Planetary Improvements in your Empire to increase this. You can also level up a System with a System Development upgrade using a Luxury Resource that generatesÂ [prestigeColored].

We are heard and seen in the schools, on the screens, in the news. Those who support and emulate the Blood Sisters flourish and grow, and the Endless are increasingly exposed as the cruel exploiters that they were. Integrity is truly a dangerous weapon.
Chapter 3. Retrench or Reform - Part 2

I am not sure if I view this as an act of treachery or desperation--or both. The ship the Reformers ride was not built in any Hissho factory; they are turning to outside forces to overthrow our emperor, turn from the Sun God, and "modernize" our nation. Though I am stunned that any true Hissho would rely on alien powers to attack their own kind, my outrage must be put aside for the moment. First and foremost, the fleet must be stopped.
RIPOSTE
They strike? We strike back! Destroy the attacking fleet--but beware the flagship.
Destroy the Behemoth targeting the SystemÂ $MyStarSystemName
The incoming fleet is identified on the galaxy map.
We have broken their fleet, and ruined their credibility in the eyes of their supporters. But they are Hissho; even though they have been defeated, they will not give up or surrender.
Reformers
1st Galactic Imperials
Chapter 3. Retrench or Reform - Part 2

It appears, frustratingly, that I have made the error of complacency! I was content to have word of the Blood Sisters and our old traditions spoken in the schools and the academies. But this is not enough; even teachers grow lax and students are masters of avoidance and evasion. Words alone are not enough, and the Hissho must show in our actions that we are determined, indomitable, and unbreakable.
ENDURE
Wealth and power have made us soft. We need to train more recruits in unforgiving environments.
Possess $Amount02Name [temperatureHot] Hot planets.
Additional planets will need to be colonized, or Systems with Hot planets invaded.

I have visited the recruits, seen with my own eyes their hours of training under searing suns upon scorching sands. They remains steadfast and indifferent, maintaining their focus without distraction. I can feel it; we are close. Very close.
Final Chapter. Written on the Blade

I must have battle or old age will take my head. Too soon, winter comes. --- The Blazehawk wrote these words years ago, and only now do I understand them. I feel that our victory is close, and that soon all Hissho will see the past as the bedrock upon which we build the future, not a ball-and-chain that holds us back. But what will happen if I am victorious? What further battles will I seek? What does the sword do when the arm becomes too frail to wield it? How can I serve my emperor and the Sun God then? When my quest began, these are certainly not the questions I thought I might be asking. But I will put off these weak, self-indulgent thoughts. Focus. Fight. It is our greatest hour, and our fleets are preparing to ride out and conquer with weapons and a will that might even have brought tears to the eyes of Akama Daitan. My blade fills with stories, and I would like to see even more.
MASTERY
For defense or offense, for control or for sacrifice to Tonatsi, we must have fleets worthy of a great empire and great adversaries.
Have at least $Amount02Name Obliterators.
You may need to research additional technologies to be able to build additional ships based on Behemoth hulls.
Have at least $Amount04Name Juggernauts.

I write these words with sadness, but not resignation. The last act of her enemies was to take Tizio Blackridge's life; a suicidal attack in which she died defending me. Her legacy will live on, her deeds will be written alongside those of the greatest of Blood Sisters. To her enemys' great regret, I still believe in Tizio's ideals and in our traditions. And I am now particularly fond of blood sacrifice. I, Emperor Iyolo Blackgyr
Final Chapter. The Eagle's Honor

I must have battle or old age will take my head. Too soon, winter comes. --- The Blazehawk wrote these words years ago, and only now do I understand them. I feel that our victory is close, and that soon all Hissho will see the past as the bedrock upon which we build the future, not a ball-and-chain that holds us back. But what will happen if I am victorious? What further battles will I seek? What does the sword do when the arm becomes too frail to wield it? How can I serve my emperor and the Sun God then? When my quest began, these are certainly not the questions I thought I might be asking. But I will put off these weak, self-indulgent thoughts. Focus. Fight. Now more than ever we must defend the gains we have made and ensure that our traditions survive. It is a time to consolidate, to plan, and to prepare for the future. The Hissho, their traditions, and the memories of the Blood Sisters will endure. Blessed be Tonatsi, the Sun God, our source and power. Glory to Iyolo Blackgyr, our emperor, the Blazehawk.
DOMINATION
I have done what I could, fought for my emperor and the blessings of Tonatsi, respected my ancestors. But one key task remains: ensure that what I have built survives.

I write these words with sadness, but not resignation. The last act of her enemies was to take Tizio Blackridge's life; a suicidal attack in which she died defending me. Her legacy will live on, her deeds will be written alongside those of the greatest of Blood Sisters. To her enemy's great regret, I still believe in Tizio, and in our traditions. Especially that of blood sacrifice. I, Emperor Iyolo Blackgyr.

Veneration or Vilification?

While it has been known for ages that the Concrete branch of the Endless subjected the Hissho to genetic manipulation, recent discoveries have come to show the extent of the change that was inflicted. Before the Endless interventions, the Hissho were thinner, lighter, faster, and had proper wings. However, after lots of market studies, it was determined that the audiences preferred Hissho that looked more like saber-wielding warriors than true birds of prey. They were therefore modified along these lines. Discovery of these facts has caused a great deal of strong feelings within the empire. While some believe that the Endless simply sped up the process of evolution, others decry the brutality and immorality of genetic manipulation. There has been violent political debate, and all signs point to impending violence in the streetsâ¦
APPRECIATE
Regardless of their methods, the results have been the peerless warriors of the Hissho empire. We should appreciate their efforts, and glorify our power.
Have $Amount01Name Planets with only Hissho Major Population

While we go forward on our own path, free of the chains of the Endless, we are still grateful for the power and perfection that they helped us to achieve. We should not forget this "gift", even if it was against our wishes.
CASTIGATE
The end does not justify the means; what the Endless did to us is inexcusable. We must concentrate on our moral nature and our honor, not glorify our bodies.
Maintain $Amount02Name [religiousColored] #D9C282#Religious#REVERT# laws for a duration of $DurationName [turn].

We must break all ties with the past and reject all that remains of the Endless. They were perverts and sadists, unworthy of our respect. This is the lesson that we will remember as we spread across the galaxy.
RECLAIM
The planet where our glory was celebrated must be ours; its memories belong to us, and no other people.

While we go forward on our own path, free of the chains of the Endless, we are still grateful for the power and perfection that they helped us to achieve. Here, on Sykagoja, the memories are part of the planet itself.
INTEGRATE
There are other Hissho species in the galaxy who represent our race in an earlier time. We should study them to learn more of ourselves.

This minor culture has a very different social memory of the Endless. To them the Endless were more like severe teachers; much was demanded, but the rewards were commensurately large. The truth, as always, wears many guises.
Uchi

The Hissho home planet is hot, craggy, and rocky, but full of lowland jungles. Though the highlands are arid and dry, the valleys and oceans of the planet form a dense forest habitat that teems with life--and prey.Â The difficult conditions have led the HIssho to be hardy and stoic, whether they are meditating in a temple carved into the side of a mountain or hunting game through dense woods. The rough terrain lent itself to development of clan and family as the root of both social and political structure, and even now that they have their eyes set on the stars the Hissho remain tied in webs of ancient loyalties.
Abyss or Apex?

Arenas ran red upon green Sykagoja. Blood fertilizes
This is the planet where much of Hissho history was shaped. Though it was developed as an enormous media center for the galaxy-wide transmission of entertainment, once the Concrete civilization fell into decadence Sykagoja became famous primarily for its bloodsports. Greatestâand most profitableâamong them were the gladiatorial arena battles of the Hissho, for they were a warrior culture that adapted eagerly to the challenges of blood and honor concocted by the Endless. In return, they received infrastructure development, education and fame. Today the arenas are overgrown; the great complexes house looters and scavengers. Is it with sadness, pride, or anger that the Hissho gaze once again upon these vast complexes?
SADNESS
It was a time of brutality and slavery; as we learn and grow we move toward a better future.
PRIDE
It was a time of fame and honor! There is no shame in glorifying our victories.
HONOR
We should not feel shame for what happened, but remember our glory and the accolades that fell upon us!
ANGER
The HIssho were treated like tamed animals! We must ensure that it can never happen again.
SHAME
We do not need this reminder of how the Endless used us. We must concentrate on building a greater future.

Words in Private

Your sole Hero, graduate of the Academy and Dust adept, has requested an audience. "Something has awakened", they confide. "The Academy has registered emissions that they do not recognize. The source is certainly an Endless-manufactured transponder." They do not wish to explain further, claiming that Academy oaths bind them from saying more on the subject of how the signal was identified. They show their loyalty, however, in helping you discover the most efficient way to uncover the truth. Whatever the artifact is, it must be powerful and certainly had military applications. Further investigation of military technologies should provide a clue...
Endless technology is safest when it is in your hands, not someone else's...

The signal came from a wreck, disturbed by adventuring explorers whose identity remains hidden. The wreck, however, is a thing that dwarfs any known ship hull, and whose exploitation goes far beyond military applications. There is much more to see, and even more to learn.

Your current technology does not allow you to know which, and the truth of it is a matter for historians, not technologists.

An Honorable Empire

The Hissho are one of the older races in the galaxy. Driven by nature and tradition to combat, they have a #FFFFFF#new gauge#REVERT# that tracks their special resource, #BD4E58#KEII#REVERT#. This Hissho concept is an ideal that combines honor, loyalty, and integrity. Keii can be thought of as an indicator of how well your style of ruling fits with Hissho tradition.

Keii increases by participating in Space Battles, succeeding in Ground Battles, and completing Quests and Deeds. Using Keii you can launch certain #FFFFFF#special actions#REVERT# that consume it. Click on #FFFF00#your Star System#REVERT# to learn more about the Hissho.
Obedient Citizens

This is a typical Hissho system. As you can see, there is no Approval resource; it has been replaced with [obedienceColored]#FFFFFF#Obedience#REVERT#. Unlike Approval, #BD4E58#Obedience#REVERT# is not influenced by Overpopulation or by the type of planet.
Obedience is linked to Keii. To see how, let's check the #FFFF00#Empire screen#REVERT#
Empire Influence

Here you can see that your current amount of [honorColored] #FFFFFF#Keii#REVERT# corresponds to your population's [obedienceColored]#FFFFFF#Obedience#REVERT#. All systems shared the same Obedience. Note that you will lose a fixed amount of Keii from certain dishonorable actions, like choosing the "Retreat" option from a Space Battle. It is better to die with honor! If the Keii drops too low, the Hissho systems will fall into Rebellion.
Colonization also consumes Keii. The amount of Keii that is consumed this way is greater if the Empire reaches the #FFFFFF#Overcolonization gauge.#REVERT#
Behemoth Specialists

The Hissho can have more #FFFF00#Behemoth#REVERT#-class ships than other Empires. Every Behemoth ship projects a zone of honor around it; honorable actions within this zone generate greater amounts of Keii.
Special Colonization
You've found a #FFFF00#Colonizable System#REVERT# with a nice-looking planet. You can set up an Outpost to turn it into a Colony, but notice that Hissho have a different colonization process.

Hissho Outposts are slow to become Colonies, and the final conversion to a Colony requires Keii (more or less depending on if you convert it sooner or later). Set up your outpost to see more information.
Outpost Action

You can now interact with your Outpost. You can speed up its development using #FFFF00#Outpost Actions#REVERT#--but these actions have a cost in Keii that decreases each turn. Note: Outpost Actions can be very costly! Make sure you are ready to lose that much Keii before you click. Even when your Outpost no longer requires additional Turns to develop, you will still need to use Keii to definitively turn it into Colony.
Mining Probe

Mining Probes are a special part of Behemoth technology. They can be used to harvest Strategic and Luxury Resources as well as FIDSI. The FIDSI that they harvest will be directly added to the FIDSI of the Home System.

Now, installing a #FFFF00#new form of government#REVERT# doesn't come for free. Influence must be paid. If you can meet the Influence cost, you can make the change. However, bear in mind that a period of Anarchy will always follow a change of government:Â $AnarchyDurationName [turn].

Did you know that you can easily move Populations between colonized planets within the same System? #FFFF00#Drag & Drop [leftClick] Populations [population] between planets#REVERT# when you want to optimize your production.
Rebellion

If your #FFFFFF#KEII#REVERT# stays under 30 for too long, your Empire will start a Rebellion (which, as you may guess, is bad news). During a rebellion, pirate fleets may spawn from your systems and attack them, and the political party that is the opposite of your current primary Senator will be elected.

Large Debris Field
The site of a major engagement between warring empires, the space surrounding this system is filled with debris of all types and sizes.
Medium Debris Field
The site of an engagement between enemy fleets, there are noticeable chunks of debris floating in the system's space.
Small Debris Field
Twisted metal remains and scorched plastics drift here, a reminder of a previous skirmish.
Pre-galactic Architecture
A minor civilization that resisted assimilation was conquered here, and signs of the battles remain.
Gutted Pirate Stronghold
A thriving pirate colony was laid to waste here, resulting in massive devastation and debris.
Gutted Pirate Lair
There was once a pirate hideout here, but only ruins and debris remain.
Gutted Pirate Hideout
A small band of pirates once held this place, but they were driven out and only some debris remains.
Apocalyptic Landscape
An enormous ground battle occurred here, and the planet will forever show the horrific scars.
Devastation
A ground battle took place here, and the planet is only slowly recovering.
Trenches
A minor engagement occurred here, but the evidence of battle is already disappearing.
Encounter Remains
The debris from the encounter can be searched, though it is hard to say if the loot will be useful or dangerous.
Minor Civilization Remains
The remains of the lesser civilization can be investigated; some useful technologies and knowledge might be uncovered.
Pirate Lair Remains
One wonders if the conquerors found all the pirate's booty? Perhaps it is worth poking around.
Ground Battle Remains
As long as you can avoid unexploded ordnance, the battlefield may yield some valuable loot.
Possible findings: High chances: - Loot Low chances: - Ship - Trap
High chance: - Anomaly Low chance: - Star System Improvement
High chance : - Anomaly Low chance : - Loot
Equal chance : - Anomaly - Loot
Search Encounter Remains
Space battles always leave debris behind; sometimes even derelict ships--occupied or unoccupied--can be found.
Search Ground Battle Remains
The devastated landscape surely hides some treasure, though it may be buried beneath rubble--or piles of bodies.
Search Pirate Lair Remains
It's worth poking around to see what the Pirates were hoarding. Just watch out for booby traps.
Search Minor Civilization Remains
Though you may scoff at these remains of a "second-class" civilization, they often contain ideas and technologies that are new.
System Relics
System Relics may appear on a node after events of particular significance took place there, leaving a lasting mark
