Fierce and aggressive, driven by their sense of honor, 
the Hissho are fearless in battle. Preferring war to 
peace, their nation has by tradition sought conquest 
and glory.
Militarists\nReligious
If you are willing to meet my terms, the Sun God may be willing to bless our trade.
If you come in friendship, I will not draw my blade or your blood.
You strive to behave honorably. I am pleased; the Sun God is pleased.
Our shared opinion of another people is interesting. I will view you favorably.
I see that your enemy is my enemy; you too walk the difficult path of honor.
The strong take from the weak. We are the strong.
You attempted to dishonor us. My desire for retribution is a warming fire.
You dishonor war by murdering the unarmed. You are the dregs of the galaxy.
You stand on our soil. Leave, or be carried out.
You are not leaving our territory. If you do not hear my warnings, perhaps you do not need your ears. Or your head.
Do not place villages on our soil. They will find that it is unwelcoming.
The Sun God smiles upon our outposts; I think he is likely to burn yours.
Honorable neighbors are acceptable neighbors.
If you do not leave your weapons at the door, they will be confiscated. Or destroyed.
Do not treat honorable Hissho like honorless scum. Unless, of course, you enjoy the sight of your own blood.
We are always driven by honor. But sometimes I must act out of necessity.
Once honor demanded we be enemies. Perhaps a time comes when we can be friends.
I did not expect you to act with honor. But I also did not expect such base infamy.
Do not be surprised if your attempt to block us and bottle us up is viewed as an act of war.
Your greed disgusts us. I am saddened to see a friend act this way.
We both take a risk; perhaps we both gain something. We shall see what our blades say of this.
Your offering to Tonatsi is accepted and appreciated.
Your relentless desire to repaint the galaxy in your colors ends here.
We close our borders and keep our counsel to ourselves. I will not leave my people exposed.
Your desire to see our blood spilled has lessened. We remain on guard, but will not attack.
If I must accept this, I will. But I will not forget it.
I only hope that your concept of honor improves through contact with ours.
We see no reason to view you with hostility. Tonatsi the Sun God smiles upon you.
You act with wisdom. There will be no bloodletting today.
We, too, are in the mood to see the color of our enemy's blood. Your directness is welcome.
To ignore my order is an insult. I can almost see the result upon my blade.
You defile the territory of our ancestors. This may well be your last act of infamy.
You steal our territory and ignore our borders? We promise you will feel little; our blades are sharp.
The ground of our ancestors is not yours to colonize. It may, however, be suitable for your cemeteries.
The grounds and territories of our ancestors are closed to you.
You have shown you do not respect our borders. I will see if you show more respect for our weapons.
You see that our warriors died well; Tonatsi has accepted their blood sacrifice. He will now accept yours.
The only currency we care for is honor, and your trinkets do not bring that.
You wish to punish us for becoming accustomed to peace. I thank you for that; we always seek glory over peace.
The sciences of the galaxy hold mysteries that are difficult to decipher. We prefer the simplicity of blood and blades.
Though honor is our preferred currency, realism means we must also think of trade and resources.
Our nation often seeks valuable resources for our industries. Your behavior says that we could perhaps trade together.
Your friendship is one of the few things I can count on in this changing galaxy. The other is the joy of battle.
Industries and artisans are content with our trade. It does not bring glory, but at least it brings contentment.
Where we once felt ignorant, the Hissho feel wise. Our agreeement to share research has brought some measure of honor.
It is unwise to make demands of friends. And even less so when the friends carry sharp blades.
Our past relations indicate your ships mean no harm. You would be wise to confirm this by removing them.
By tradition, we keep our territory free of trespassers and our streets free of beggars. We thank you for respecting this.
We do not wish to have your fleets in our territory. I will sharpen my blade and watch them.
Your refusal to leave our territory means that I must plan for the worst. The worst for you, that is.
Your demand seemed reasonable. Yet no gesture from you dishonors me.
Your fleets continue to annoy us like mosquitos. Remove them before they are slapped.
Your willingness to remove fleets from Hissho territory is a gesture of goodwill. Or a sign of wisdom.
Even mere politeness seems impossible for you. The next sacrifice to Tonatsi may be our peaceful relations.
Your gesture is understood. I would have been happier if it had come sooner, and with more enthusiasm.
We are unafraid to make the ultimate sacrifice in war, but our losses mount. I have lost favor with the Sun God, and hope to find favor with you.
As enemies group like flocks of carrion birds, I seek reliable allies with which to defy them.
Our peace has been stable; you are worthy of trust. I begin to consider an alliance, one that would be sealed in the blood of common enemies.
Enemies join together like locusts swarming. We would be wise to join forces, the better to swat them.
We are like two hunters chasing the same prey. It may be wise to hunt together rather than separately.
Our blades are well-used, but never pointed at you. We wonder if an alliance would be logical.
The vision I have for my nation seems to be the same as yours. Perhaps we should seek it together.
The time to call upon alliances and honor is at hand. Come! Let us spill blood together.
When you ally with the Hissho, you become part of our nation. If honorless fools dare attack you, the nation will respond.Â
It does not matter if we worship different gods. Our alliance is an honorable one, and worthy of respect.
The nation admires your behavior and loyalty. I am honored to present the gift, on their behalf.
It is a poor houseguest who only makes demands, and never shows appreciation. That houseguest should not be tolerated.
It is as if my family makes a demand of me. Are we not of the same nation?
It is good that you see the error of your ways, and atone for poor behavior. You are again in the good graces of my clan and nation.
A poor effort is little better than no effort. The nation sees little value in your gift.
Hardship and sacrifice are our way. We are saddened, however, that it is an ally that forces us opon that path. We forgive, but don't forget.
Your help is late. Though it has deprived us of the glory of a bloody last stand, it is still welcome.
You joined with our nation, yet ignored it in time of need. We wonder if you are capable of acting with honor.
You have taken the territory of our nation, our ancestors, as if it was your own. Your nation is no longer part of our nation.
To conquer the systems of an ally is an act of infamy, reserved for honorless scum. Is my opinion of your actions clear?
The nation has many allies and powers. We hope this one is of value to you.
This act was unexpected and... interesting. Time will tell if it is an act of peace or war.
You, too, wish to have your blood sacrificed to Tonatsi on the blades of Hissho warriors? We are happy to comply, as soon as we finish the current war.
You have blocked us in, like a mighty oak in a tiny pot. We have no choice byt to break out.
You seem eager to spill the blood of your soldiers. We are eager to help you do so.
It is an act of honorless cowardice to make war on the innocent. You will feel the Sun God's wrath for this.
We would prefer that you let the blood of warriors, who are prepared to make this sacrifice. But you are scum who prefer to slaughter civilians.
You play with the ecology of our planets, bringing forth your forest demons.
I see that in your society it is acceptable to slaughter innocent populations. When the time comes, we will return the favor.
Your time manipulation lies somewhere between technology and magic. It is strange, but of value to us.
Your scientific sorcery attacks the equilibrium of our system. Remember that this is a hostile act, and we are fond of reciprocating.
You conquer systems and fight wars with culture and propaganda. If you do this again, we may decide to fight the war our way.
Your cultural infection of our system is akin to fighting with biological weapons. Clearly, you have no interest in being at peace.
Your desire to convert the culture of our glorious traditions to those of your social media experts has ceased. You chose wisely.
Your act of scientific wizardry was not a hostile one. We are pleased to see your change of heart.
You have crippled a system with your time manipulation. We, too, prefer hot wars to cold ones.
We are a hair's breadth from war, and you blockade our system. Honor demands we consider the obvious next step.
You have demanded a blood sacrifice of my nation--one that was unplanned, and unwilling. More blood will soon be running.
The strength of our traditions and the power of the Sun God were in our favor. The galaxy is large, and you can colonize elsewhere.
You have taken a system that the Hissho desired. For your sake, we hope the galaxy is large enough for our traditions to root elsewhere.
Tonatsi does not demand tribute lightly. Your refusal to make an offering can only be seen as an insult to our honor.
You threaten our borders with your fleets and patrols. We are unafraid of war, but do not seek it now.
My nation does not desire to make the final blood sacrifice to Tonatsi. Why do you insist?
We do not wish to have giants stomping in our gardens. Our borders are closed to you.
My nation tires of being used for your target practice. Perhaps one day it will be your turn to make the sacrifice.
Your honorless greed drives you to consume systems like a child gobbles candies. You will find that Hissho systems taste of blood and anguish.
Your use of this weapon violates every code and law of the natural universe. The Sun God will not see his works butchered this way.
Blood sacrifice is a thing we understand. Mindless eradication of millions of innocents, we do not.
Your lust for violence and savagery must end. Tonatsi himself is outraged by your brutality; he will decide your fate.
Accepting your ultimatum felt like a betrayal of our honor. Now you are being honest about your intentions; that must have been painful.
You are an odd people, that use acts of peace as if they were blades.
A peace is preferable to armadas of ships. And much less expected. The Sun God bless you.
Forcing a peace? This is like being smothered with flowers. We resheath our blades, and gasp for air.
Though you managed to invent the unthinkable--a dishonorable peace--you have redeemed yourself by maintaining it.
As we suspected, your "peace" was simply another tactic of war. It was sleazy and despicable, and we are glad to see it end.
It is easy to claim good intent. But the Sun God demands something more tangible than words and promises in exchange for peace...
With this gift you have made efforts to match your actions to your words, and Tonatsi approves.Â
To pretend that peace is desired, but not worth a minor sacrifice, does not make us believe you are honorable or sincere.
Peace has never been our strong point. I thank you for giving us an excuse for war.
Silence. Your whining annoys me.
We will see whose god's fury burns the brighter!
Capture of a system is an act of war; Â do not pretend that doing so with pretty phrases makes it different.
It is not "peace" if it hides aggressions. You took our system, and you will feel the Sun God's wrath.
You steal systems from our nation while wearing the mask of an ally? I can think of few better causes for war!
A state of cold war does not indicate friendship. But it does not call for wholesale butchery, either. You will be hunted like the beasts you are.
You eradicate system like civilized beings slap mosquitos. Your savagery is repugnant, and your lust for blood is honorless.
You have great power, and you use it only to spill blood. The galaxy grieves as you reduce the works of the gods to dust.
You have obliterated a system belonging to an ally; Tonatsi's retribution is coming.
Your use of extreme weapons concerns us, though we are content to see that you aim them at the Sun God's enemies.
There are those who fight with honor, and then there is you. Our slaughtered kin cry out for justice.
Peace?! There cannot be peace between us when you butcher the citizens of my ally.
A more odious and infamous act is not known in Hissho memory. You will pay for your lust to spill the blood of innocents.
The notion of an alliance is alien to a beast like you. May you soon forfeit your notions of life.
There are things that the Sun God, Tonatsi, demands of us so that we maintain our honor. The glory of the blood sacrifice will be yours.
We find honor in conflict; in your craven insistence on peace you will find nothing but shame.
Remove your fleets that trespass in our ancestors' territory.
Remove your colonies that border Hissho territory.
Stop your attacks on our fleets and our systems.
The Hissho insist that you cease this disgraceful theft of our systems.
I insist that you stop drawing the Essence from Hissho systems.
The Hissho insist that you stop your time manipulations in our systems.
I insist that you remove your vines and weeds from Hissho systems.
The presence of your ships in Hissho systems feels like an invasion. Remove them.
In honor, and in the name of the Sun God, Tonatsi, we greet you.
Hissho honor has been preserved, and our troops trained. We are prepared to offer a truce.
You are wise to offer a truce, and we are generous to accept it.
Tonatsi's favor is not with us in this. We propose a truce, that we may regain his esteem.
Your proposal is welcomed, and accepted. We would spend our resources on other efforts for our nation.
Your actions do not do honor to a status of peace. Cold War seems a more honest description.
You wish Cold War, not Peace. I accept, as our blades have been getting rusty.
Your infamy and treachery have no place in an alliance. Let us admit we are at Cold War, and move forward from there.
There are many benefits from an alliance. But with Cold War comes the chance of glory and sacrifice; we accept.
I see that the truce serves little purpose. My nation is not unhappy to return to blood sacrifice and battle!
The truce a ruse, and war your purpose? Regardless. You give our blades the chance to run red, and we are grateful.
The way of battle and blood is an honorable one; we shall walk it together.
It is unusual to see others so eager for war and blood sacrifice. The Sun God will accept your souls.
Your notion of peace is not one that pleases my nation. We shall see if our notion of war pleases yours.
You are so eager to offer your lives to Tonatsi? We are eager to accept your sacrifice.
Our allliance was a failure. Through war, however, we may redeem our honor in the eyes of our gods.
This is infamy and treachery. But do not fear; we shall take all the blood you are willing to spill.
Truce is a confusing state of war-not-war. We, too, prefer clarity.
Niether glory nor profit is achieved by cold war. Instead of war this time, let us try Peace.
My nation waits to see how you conduct yourself in Peace. If it is honorable, we will be content to have left this cold war behind us.
We do not believe your intentions are as peaceful as you claim. Cold War is preferred.
We do not believe your intentions are as peaceful as you claim. Cold War is preferred.
I am curious to see if you could conduct an Alliance with the same honor you showed during cold war.
Not merely peace, but an Alliance? Let us see if honorable enemies can be honorable allies.
You ask too much, too quickly. I do not believe you will honor such an alliance.
You ask too much, too quickly. I do not believe you will honor such an alliance.
What do you say to advancing, blades together, from peace into an alliance?
You have acted honorably, and we agree that an alliance would aid us all.
My nation is not yet ready to join our blades in a full alliance; this peace suits us well.
My nation is not yet ready to join our blades in a full alliance; this peace suits us well.
As emperor of the Hissho nation and disciple of the Sun God, Tonatsi, I offer you this.
There is nothing dishonorable or foolish in your proposal. I accept.
I am not ready to impose the conditions of this offer upon my nation.
I am not ready to impose the conditions of this offer upon my nation.
We have work, training, and offerings to make. I have no time for your diplomacy.
This declaration is a necessity, for the good of my nation and the needs of our faith.
You wish to impose this upon the Hissho? Whatever else you are, you're brave.
We see in you the courage and honor we see in ourselves.
Your message is agreeable; I accept it for my nation and the Sun god.
Your lack of honor, intelligence, and courage is to be expected from such a base and corrupted people.
You send insults. We sharpen blades.
This is not meant to offend, it is simple an indication of our strength due to the Sun God's blessings.
We acknowledge. But my nation does not agree, nor will I forget.
It is a time for sacrifice; your sacrifice. Blessed be Tonatsi.
Are you so eager to bleed? We are certainly eager to help you do so.
Strength also comes from trade in goods and knowledge. Shall our nations profit from each other?
The Hissho see honor and profit in this. May Tonatsi bless our agreement.
We see much good for you, but too little for us. The Hissho do not wish to trade at the moment.
We see much good for you, but too little for us. The Hissho do not wish to trade at the moment.
As bees may share a flower, we could share the wealth of scientific discovery.
Hissho are courageous, but not foolish. We see strength in this science agreement.
The sort of knowledge you seek is not of interest to the warriors and priests of the Hissho.
The sort of knowledge you seek is not of interest to the warriors and priests of the Hissho.
War is neither frightening nor unnatural. With the Sun God protection, we shall surely prevail.
You seem unsure of what you want. Perhaps a Hissho blade at your throat will clarify your thoughts.
You slam the door in our faces? Interesting. But know that if the Hissho wish to enter your house, we will.
As long as you treat my nation honorably, I am content to share its riches with you.
There are times when the Sun God demands silence and introspection from us. We will not open our borders.
There are times when the Sun God demands silence and introspection from us. We will not open our borders.
We do not feel you have been honorable or equitable. And now, you are out of our borders.
The Hissho have need to pass through your territory; but we do not make demands, only offers.
Your words do not interest me.
I acknowledge your words and your intent. May Tonatsi bring our discussions to a just conclusion.
I am Iyolo Blackgyr. I have the honor to be the emperor of a great people, and the servant of the Sun God.
Hissho eyes are sharp, but have not seen everything. We welcome this sharing of maps.
We would be glad to see through the eyes of your raptors as they fly.
We wonder what you suddenly wish to hide from us. I am not happy, but I acknowledge your decision.
Our goods are excellent and our merchants honorable. If you no longer wish to trade, it is your loss.
You no longer wish to share knowledge? The Hissho will let you drown in your ignorance.
We propose that we share vision, like many raptors with shared eyes.
The eyes of our ships are closed to you; our warriors will guard their observations for themselves.
The eyes of the Sun God see much, but not all; let us exchange our maps and share our knowledge of the galaxy.
The scientists of the Hissho are dedicated but not omnipotent. Shall we share our discoveries, that all may profit?
We are content--surprisingly--to pause this war and take count of our situation. A truce suits us.
The Sun God demands observances and the nation demands answers. We propose a truce, to weigh the progress of this war.
We see no reason to stop amassing honor and seeking glory. A truce would be demeaning
We see no reason to stop amassing honor and seeking glory. A truce would be demeaning
What Hissho scouts have seen remains the business of the emperor and the Sun God. They are not for you.
What Hissho scouts have seen remains the business of the emperor and the Sun God. They are not for you.
Your proposal is interesting, but not enough to agree with. No being but Tonatsi has the right to see what we see.
Your proposal is interesting, but not enough to agree with. No being but Tonatsi has the right to see what we see.
Vessels of the Heart
Like the circulation in a living being, this network of friendly outposts across the galaxy aid the Unfallen in trade, science, communication, and development.
Resilient
This civilization has a natural focus on emergency management and stockpiling so it can better survive cataclysmic events like Obliterator's missiles
Adds an Obliterator Shield to your Home System
We dislike bowing to the demands of others. It is a matter of honor, so you wouldn't understand.
For my nation, this is a necessity. The Sun God wills it.
Your gift does honor to both of our nations. I accept it in the name of the Sun God.
Your behavior brings honor to you; this is a gesture of our appreciation.
We see little value in out commercial dealings, so I withdraw my nation from our treaty.
Your supposed wisdom and knowledge bring little advantage to my nation.
I offer you this proposition, as emperor of the Hissho nation and disciple of Tonatsi.
I do not see the good of my nation in this offer you make; I will not accept it.
I do not see the good of my nation in this offer you make; I will not accept it.
Your proposal brings benefits to the children of the Sun God; I accept it.
I guess the word "cold" is one too many syllables for you. That's it, the war is going to get hot.
Hey! Blowing things up is only acceptable if a) it's for science, and b) the only risk is to the scientist!
Great. We're sharing a galaxy with a brainless, over-muscled psychopath.
You just blew up my ally's system! What were you thinking? Oh, right, you weren't. As usual.
I guess if you have to blow stuff up, you might as well blow our enemy's stuff up, But still...
Look, nobody comes in ahead of us when it comes to blowing stuff up for fun. But don't do it when there are civilians there!
Peace does not mean "okay, please slaughter my ally". Why am I stuck with the etymologically challenged?
NO. Just, no. You actually blew up an ally's system? Is this some game show "The Incredible Shrinking Brain"??
What is it with you and wholesale murder? You can't claim that it's science, pal. That's pure, unhinged sociopathy.
Honor and science demand war! And yes, that makes perfect sense.
You butcher during cold war. You must have many mouths to feed. Maybe we'll reduce that.
A stupid waste of unconsumed resources. Your weapon is impressive, but foolish.
You have taken more than warriors. We do not like your way of killing.
You explode the worlds of allies, without even the intelligence to consume them first.
Wasteful, but efficient. The Cravers would have consumed the world before rendering it unusable as a base.
You have attacked the Hive, without provocation.Â
I had hoped you would believe in peace, but your gratuitous destruction of an ally's system convinces me it is a waste to think so.
What manner of idiocy is this?! You have destroyed my system--an ally's system! Even an idiot like you can imagine the consequences.
No. You cannot destroy an ally's system and expect there to be no consequences. You bring ruin on us all.
For the honor of my people, and for the Hive, it is time for us to launch the machines of war.
You're killing off the customers! There is no greater casus belli.
Your random acts of destruction have been noticed, and you will be judeged by them.
